name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** **FIGO and extension information** 
* When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the code in preference to a statement of FIGO stage.

**Note 2:** **STIC** 
* Code 050 is for the following in situ histology (behavior /2) only
  - High-grade serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC) (8441/2)

**Note 3:** **Malignant ascites** 
* Tumors in codes 100-250 with malignant ascites are coded 300. 
  * Ascites, NOS should be excluded as a staging element

**Note 4:** **Fallopian tube involvement** 
* If there is involvement of the fallopian tube with no further evidence of extension, and the physician verifies this is an ovary primary, code 400.

**Note 5:** **Pelvic organs** 
* Both extension to and/or discontinuous metastasis to any of the following pelvic organs are included in code 450
  - Adjacent (pelvic) peritoneum
  - Bladder
  - Bladder serosa
  - Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
  - Ligament(s) (broad, ovarian, round, suspensory)
  - Mesosalpinx (Mesovarium) 
  - Parametrium
  - Pelvic wall
  - Rectosigmoid
  - Rectum
  - Sigmoid colon (including sigmoid mesentery)
  - Ureter (pelvic portion)

**Note 6:** **Peritoneal implants** 
* Peritoneal implants or peritoneal carcinomatosis may also be called seeding, salting, talcum powder appearance, or studding.
  * Code 600, 650, or 700 based on microscopic or the macroscopic size
* Extraperitoneal carcinomatosis are coded in EOD Mets (code 50)

**Note 7:** **Location of peritoneal implants** 
* If implants are mentioned, determine whether they are in the pelvis or in the abdomen and code appropriately. If the location of the implants is not specified, code 750.

**Note 8:** **Abdominal organs** 
* Both extension to and/or discontinuous metastasis to any of the following abdominal organs by way of peritoneal seeding or implants are included in codes 600-750
  - Abdominal mesentery
  - Diaphragm
  - Gallbladder
  - Intestine, large (except rectum, rectosigmoid and sigmoid colon)
  - Kidneys
  - Omentum (infracolic, NOS)
  - Pancreas
  - Pericolic gutter
  - Peritoneum, NOS
  - Small intestine
  - Stomach
  - Ureters (outside pelvis)

**Note 9:** **Peritoneal surface of the liver** 
* Tumor limited to the peritoneal surface of the liver or splenic capsule is coded 700, regardless of the size (microscopic or macroscopic).
   - Any **parenchymal** involvement of the liver or spleen is coded in EOD Mets (code 50)

**Note 10:** **Benign/borderline tumors** 
* In some registries benign/borderline ovarian tumors are reportable by agreement. 
  * If the tumor being reported is benign or borderline, code 999.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(5) **Introduction to Female Reproductive Organs**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(6) Prat, J., Olawaiye, A.B., Mutch, D.G., et al. **Ovary, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017
rows:
In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive, preinvasive 
Low grade (LGSC) serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC) (8441/2)
Serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC) (no grade) (8441/2)

Limited to one ovary (capsule intact) AND
* No tumor on ovarian surface AND
* No malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
* WITH or WITHOUT high-grade serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma (STIC)

FIGO Stage IA

Limited to both ovaries (capsule(s) intact) AND
* No tumor on ovarian surface AND
* No malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IB

Limited to one or both ovaries
- WITH surgical spill

FIGO Stage IC1

Limited to one or both ovaries
* WITH capsule ruptured before surgery OR
* WITH tumor on ovarian surface 

FIGO Stage IC2

Limited to one or both ovaries
* Malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IC3

Limited to one or both ovaries
- UNKNOWN if capsule(s) ruptured
- UNKNOWN if cells in ascites or peritoneal washings
- UNKNOWN if surgical spill or capsule ruptured
- UNKNOWN if tumor on ovarian surface 

Confined to ovary, NOS
Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Extension to or implants on
- Adnexa
- Fallopian tube(s)
- Uterus, NOS

FIGO Stage IIA

Extension to and/or discontinuous metastasis 
* To pelvic sites (See Note 5)

FIGO Stage IIB

Tumor involves one or both ovaries
- WITH pelvic extension, NOS (below pelvic brim)

FIGO Stage II [NOS]

Microscopic peritoneal implants or microscopic peritoneal carcinomatosis
* Beyond pelvis (above pelvic brim) (See Note 8)

FIGO Stage IIIA

Macroscopic peritoneal implants or macroscopic peritoneal carcinomatosis
* 2 cm or less in greatest dimension (beyond pelvis-above pelvic brim) (See Note 8)

FIGO Stage IIIB

Macroscopic peritoneal implants or macroscopic peritoneal carcinomatosis
* Greater than 2 cm in greatest dimension (beyond pelvis-above pelvic brim) (See Note 8)

Extension or implants (microscopic, macroscopic or unknown) to the peritoneal surface of the liver or splenic capsule
   * WITHOUT parenchymal involvement of either organ

FIGO Stage IIIC

One or both ovaries involved
- WITH confirmed peritoneal metastasis or peritoneal carcinomatosis outside of the pelvis (above pelvic brim)
- UNKNOWN if microscopic or macroscopic 

Peritoneal implants, NOS

Further contiguous extension

FIGO Stage III [NOS]

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
